Hubble deep field gets me every time. 2-years ago I got an itch to learn about space after watching the Cosmos series on Fox. I started watching a bunch of videos about space. Somebody left a  comment on one of the videos. He said if you think this is fascinating you should check out Einstein's general relativity. I had no I idea what it was. The only thing I knew about Einstein was E=MC squared. I downloaded one video about it to watch on a flight while I was going on vacation. It blew my mind. Time dilation and black holes had me like Whoaaaaaaa. I couldn't wait to get back to learn more. I've read at least 7 books about it. Love it

Btw, physicsgirl...
That moment when you said that space will eventually expand to the point where particles can no longer exist, that means the entire "value" of the universe will be energy right? Flying out in all directions at >c, wouldn't that essentially be another "big-bang" as the way we understand physics would no longer apply, as space is "broken" we would be in a state resembling the moment/s illustrated at the turning point of the Hawking-Hartle method. And assumedly, new fundamental constants would be formed allowing the energy to evolve into matter once again. Repeating the history of the universe in altering iterations.
